intro: Gomphocarpus scaber, commonly known as the rough bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in wet or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist soil conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
